Surgebinder Surgebinders can manipulate ten fundamental forces locally known as Surges, with each Surgebinder having access to two of the Surges with overlap between them, by infusing objects or beings with Stormlight.
Order of the Windrunners The Windrunners are Surgebinders who use the Surges of Adhesion and Gravitation. Those who join the Windrunners generally subscribe to a philosophy of protection, particularly defending innocents or those who are unable to protect themselves.
Order of the Skybreakers The Skybreakers are Surgebinders who use the Surges of Gravitation and Division. The individuals who join the Skybreakers generally believe in following a strong moral code. They wish to prevent both anarchy and tyranny. To do so, they enforce the law on everyone.
Order of the Dustbringers The Dustbringers are Surgebinders who control the Surges of Division and Abrasion. The Dustbringers believe that great power requires a strong will to control it, and their oaths are designed to teach them to control their destructive power.
Order of the Edgedancers The Edgedancers are Surgebinders who use the Surges of Abrasion and Progression. Edgedancers generally subscribe to a philosophy of remembering the ordinary people of the world. The order considers it their solemn duty to remember that the people are the ones they truly serve.
Order of the Truthwatchers The Truthwatchers are Surgebinders who used the Surges of Illumination and Progression. Those who join the Truthwatchers generally subscribe to a philosophy of finding the ultimate truth and sharing it. The order is concerned with the fundamental truths of the universe, and whether or not those in power are being truthful with the people they lead.
Order of the Lightweavers The Lightweavers are Surgebinders who use the Surges of Illumination and Transformation. While each order of Radiants contains a variety of personalities within it, those who join the Lightweavers generally subscribe to a philosophy of speaking truths about themselves that they must admit in order to progress as people.
Order of the Elsecallers The Elsecallers were Surgebinders who used the Surges of Transformation and Transportation. Those who join the Elsecallers generally subscribe to a philosophy that they should be becoming better with each oath, seeking to explore their true potential and reach it. The order is more open to all types of people, as long as they want to improve themselves.
